column3: This seems to import all kinds of ancillary changes?\n
Yes, it's based on #5618. The cost of continually rebasing things like this without it seems higher than the cost of just merging it...\n

That's fine but a) You should at least list all the changes that you make in the PR description b) Some of these have been rejected before, sometimes multiple times, such as having a configuration option for every single utility.\n
Not relevant to Luke's PR but this sort of thing "xnononononono", looks like it would be easy to screw up. Any good reason for it?\n
@kirkalx I commented on that too when that was introduced, but apparently that's the portable shell script way of doing things. Blame silly 80's UNIX's inheritance.\n
I think this is too messy with all the merges factored in, closing.\n
